ID: A unique integer identifier of a customer.
BAL_LIMIT: Amount of the given credit, which includes both the individual consumer credit and his/her family (supplementary) credit.
EDUCATION: Education (1 = graduate school; 2 = university; 3 = high school; 4 = others).
BILLED_AMT1: Amount of billing statement in September, 2005
BILLED_AMT2: Amount of billing statement in August, 2005
BILLED_AMT3: Amount of billing statement in July, 2005
BILLED_AMT4: Amount of billing statement in June, 2005
BILLED_AMT5: Amount of billing statement in May, 2005
BILLED_AMT6: Amount of billing statement in April, 2005
PAST_1: Repayment status in September, 2005. The measurement scale for the repayment status is: -1 = paid duly; 0 = paid duly; 1 = payment delay for one month; 2 = payment delay for two months; . . .; 8 = payment delay for eight months; 9 = payment delay for nine months and above.
PAST_2: Repayment status in August, 2005. The measurement scale for the repayment status is: -1 = paid duly; 0 = paid duly; 1 = payment delay for one month; 2 = payment delay for two months; . . .; 8 = payment delay for eight months; 9 = payment delay for nine months and above.
PAST_3: Repayment status in July, 2005. The measurement scale for the repayment status is: -1 = paid duly; 0 = paid duly; 1 = payment delay for one month; 2 = payment delay for two months; . . .; 8 = payment delay for eight months; 9 = payment delay for nine months and above.
PAST_4: Repayment status in June, 2005. The measurement scale for the repayment status is: -1 = paid duly; 0 = paid duly; 1 = payment delay for one month; 2 = payment delay for two months; . . .; 8 = payment delay for eight months; 9 = payment delay for nine months and above.
PAST_5: Repayment status in May, 2005. The measurement scale for the repayment status is: -1 = paid duly; 0 = paid duly; 1 = payment delay for one month; 2 = payment delay for two months; . . .; 8 = payment delay for eight months; 9 = payment delay for nine months and above.
PAST_6: Repayment status in April, 2005. The measurement scale for the repayment status is: -1 = paid duly; 0 = paid duly; 1 = payment delay for one month; 2 = payment delay for two months; . . .; 8 = payment delay for eight months; 9 = payment delay for nine months and above.
PAID_NEXT_MONTH: Whether the customer paid duly for the next month (0 = not paid, 1 = paid).
